core package¶

core.TrajectoryDF module¶

class core.TrajectoryDF.NumPandasTraj(data_set: Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, List, Dict], latitude: str, longitude: str, datetime: str, traj_id: str, rest_of_columns: Optional[List[str]] = None)¶

Bases: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

property datetime¶

Accessor method for the DateTime column of the DaskTrajectoryDF.

dask.dataframe.core.Series

The Series containing all the DateTime values from the DataFrame.

MissingColumnsException

DateTime column is missing from the data.

get_default_column_names(DateTime, traj_id, latitude, longitude) → dict¶

Get a dictionary containing the key, value pairs of the library default column names for the following columns:

  1. Latitude

  2. Longitude

  3. DateTime

  4. Trajectory ID

DateTime: Text

The datetime header of the column already given by the user.

traj_id: Text

The traj_id header of the column already given by the user.

latitude:

The latitude header of the column already given by the user.

longitude:

The longitude header of the column already given by the user.

dict

A dictionary of mappings from the given header by the user to the library default headers.

property latitude¶

Accessor method for the latitude column of the DaskTrajectoryDF.

dask.dataframe.core.Series

The Series containing all the latitude values from the DataFrame.

MissingColumnsException

Latitude column is missing from the data.

property longitude¶

Accessor method for the longitude column of the DaskTrajectoryDF.

dask.dataframe.core.Series

The Series containing all the longitude values from the DataFrame.

MissingColumnsException

Longitude column is missing from the data

plot_folium_traj(color: str = 'blue', weight: float = 3, opacity: float = 0.5)¶

Use folium to plot the trajectory on a map.

color: Text

The color of the trajectory line on the map.

weight: float

The weight of the trajectory line on the map.

opacity: float

The opacity of the trajectory line on the map.

folium.folium.Map

The map with plotted trajectory.

rename_df_col_headers(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, lat: str, lon: str, datetime: str, traj_id: str)¶

Change the column headers of the columns when the user given data is in the form of a pandas DF while creating the NumPandasTraj. This method is mainly used when the user reads in data from a csv because the CSV file might contain different names for the columns.

data: DataFrame

The dataframe whose column names are to be changed.

lat: Text

The header of the Latitude column.

lon: Text

The header of the Longitude column.

datetime: Text

The header of the DateTime column.

traj_id: Text

The header of the Trajectory ID column.

pandas.DataFrame

The pandas dataframe containing the library default column headers.

sort_by_traj_id_and_datetime(ascending=True)¶

Sort the trajectory in Ascending or descending order based on the following 2 columns in order:

  1. Trajectory ID

  2. DateTime

ascending: bool

Whether to sort the values in ascending order or descending order.

NumPandasTraj

The sorted dataframe.

to_numpy(dtype=None, copy: bool = False, na_value=<object object>) → numpy.ndarray¶

Convert the DataFrame to a NumPy array.By default, the dtype of the returned array will be the common dtype of all types in the DataFrame. For example, if the dtypes are float16 and float32, the results dtype will be float32. This may require copying data and coercing values, which may be expensive

dtype:

The dtype to pass to numpy.asarray().

copy:

Whether to ensure that the returned value is not a view on another array. Note that copy=False does not ensure that to_numpy() is no-copy. Rather, copy=True ensure that a copy is made, even if not strictly necessary.

na_value:

The value to use for missing values. The default value depends on dtype and the dtypes of the DataFrame columns.

property traj_id¶

Accessor method for the Trajectory_ID column of the DaskTrajectoryDF.

dask.dataframe.core.Series

The Series containing all the Trajectory_ID values from the DataFrame.

MissingColumnsException

traj_id column is missing from the data.

validate_columns(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → bool¶

Check whether all the columns are present in the DataFrame or not.

data

Data is the dask DataFrame containing all the data passed in by the user.

bool

Indicate whether or not all the columns that are mandatory are present in the Data given by the user.

MissingColumnsException

One or more of the mandatory columns (Latitude, Longitude, DateTime, Traj_ID) are missing in the data.

validate_data_types(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)¶

Check whether all the data given by the user is of valid type and if it isn’t, it converts them to the specified data types.

  1. Trajectory_ID: Any -> str

  2. LAT and LONG: Any -> float64

  3. DateTime: Any -> dask.datetime64[ns]

data: pd.DataFrame

This is the dataframe that contains the data that was passed in by the user. The data is converted to pandas DF eventually in the import_data function anyway.

KeyError:

Dataframe has one of the mandatory columns missing.

ParserError:

The DateTime format provided is invalid and cannot be parsed as pandas DateTime.

ValueError:

One of the data-types cannot be converted.
